title: econmaett.github.io
text:
Hi there! My name is Matt and I am an economist and data scientist based in Zurich, Switzerland.
Here’s a little bit about me and my life.

title: econmaett.github.io
text:
Education
I hold a master’s degree in economics and data analytics from the University of St. Gallen and I am particularly interested in forecasting and automation.

title: econmaett.github.io
text:
Skills
I am proficient in open source programming languages such as R, Python, and Julia.
When I’m not designing beautiful analyses you will most likely find me scuba diving in lake Zurich or skiing in the snowy Alps.

title: Projects
text:
Spotify Today’s Top Songs Dashboard



R


Quarto


Dashboard



Quarto dashboard accessing the Spotify Web API to create a dashboard of Today’s Top Songs. GitHub Actions automatically updates the dashboard every day at 9am. It is based on Melissa van Bussel’s award-winning submission to the Posit PBC Table…



2025-03-01














Quarto Dashboard with Plotly



R


Quarto


Dashboard


Plotly



Automated Quarto dashboard using plotly to display the U.S. Consumer Price Index (CPI) and related measures of inflation.



2024-06-01

title: Third Blog Post
text:
The source for any page in your website could also be a Jupyter Notebook. This one is third-post/index.ipynb.
Here’s an example I borrowed from the Seaborn docs:

import seaborn as sns

sns.set_theme(style="whitegrid")

# Load the diamonds dataset
diamonds = sns.load_dataset("diamonds")

# Plot the distribution of clarity ratings, conditional on carat
sns.displot(
    data=diamonds,
    x="carat", hue="cut",
    kind="kde", height=4, aspect=1.5,
    multiple="fill", clip=(0, None),
    palette="ch:rot=-.25,hue=1,light=.75",   
)
